    Cluster dendrogram visualization

    VisClusterTree.Rd

    Build a hierarchical tree of clusters using average expression profiles.

    Usage

    VisClusterTree(
  object,
  group.by = "seurat_clusters",
  assay = NULL,
  dist.metric = "euclidean",
  linkage = "complete",
  label.size = 3,
  show_heatmap = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    object

    A Seurat object.

    group.by

    Metadata column for cluster identity.

    assay

    Assay name.

    dist.metric

    Distance metric: 'euclidean' or 'correlation'.

    linkage

    Linkage method, e.g., 'complete','average','ward.D2'.

    label.size

    Label size for cluster names.

    show_heatmap

    If TRUE, append a pairwise similarity heatmap under the tree.

    Value

    A ggplot dendrogram (or patchwork with heatmap).

    Examples

    obj <- SeuratVisProExample()
#> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck
#> 
#> Number of nodes: 300
#> Number of edges: 11471
#> 
#> Running Louvain algorithm...
#> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8323
#> Number of communities: 3
#> Elapsed time: 0 seconds
p <- VisClusterTree(obj, group.by = 'seurat_clusters')
#> As of Seurat v5, we recommend using AggregateExpression to perform pseudo-bulk analysis.
#> This message is displayed once per session.
#> First group.by variable `seurat_clusters` starts with a number, appending `g` to ensure valid variable names
#> This message is displayed once every 8 hours.
p
